Posts.Content: loopey wrote: I had a lumpectomy at the end of October.  Am stage 1 but haven't started radiation yet.  Half of my left breast on the opposite side of my breast from the lumpectomy has turned pink but there is no reason for it and it has no different feeling.  I had a shot of radioactive material to determine which lymph nodes to remove but that was 3 months ago and my breast just got the pink color 6 days ago.  It covers about 1/2 the breast.  Anyone have any idea about what this could be? Log in to post a reply
Posts.Title: Pink Skin on Breast loopey lassman

Posts.Content: Jun 28, 2011 02:12PM loopey wrote: My son had malignant melanoma in 1996.  There were no lymph nodes involved.  In 2003 he had a lump in his groin which he thought was scar tissue from the lymph node removal.  He had a scan that was bad, had surgery, the melanoma had spread to his nodes and his abdomen.  After the surgery, he went on Interferon for a year and as of today he is cancer free.  He is a miracle and it is important that everyone believe that they can and will happen.
Posts.Title: Sort of OT, Anyone have expierence with Malignant Melanoma? irish22 geewhiz
